meanings.definition: The state or quality of being mature.
meanings.sent1: Her maturities showed in her responsible behavior.
meanings.sent2: The maturities of the fruit indicated it was ready to eat.
meanings.sent3: His maturities in decision-making were quite impressive for his age.
meanings.sent4: The maturities of the wine could be tasted in its rich flavor.
meanings.sent5: The maturities of the oak tree were evident in its sturdy trunk and branches.

meanings.definition: The time when an investment or loan becomes due for payment.
meanings.sent1: The maturities of the bonds were carefully planned by the investor.
meanings.sent2: She kept track of the maturities of her loans to avoid late payments.
meanings.sent3: The maturities of the loans sneaked up on him faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: The maturities of the investments brought in a good return.
meanings.sent5: He marked the maturities of each investment on his calendar to stay organized.

meanings.definition: The process of reaching full growth or development.
meanings.sent1: The plant's maturities were evident in its blooming flowers.
meanings.sent2: The maturities of the child were celebrated by the family.
meanings.sent3: The maturities of the project were delayed due to unforeseen issues.
meanings.sent4: The maturities of the company were reflected in its expanding market share.
meanings.sent5: The maturities of the caterpillar amazed the children as it transformed into a butterfly.
